title: Input & Output Functions
subject: C Programming
theory:
Communicating with user. 
- **printf()**: Output to console. Uses format specifiers to insert vars.
- **scanf()**: Input from console. Needs address of variable (`&`).

common_mistakes.correction: `scanf("%d", age)` will crash. Must be `&age` (Address of age).

exam_notes: Return value of printf/scanf (printf returns char count, scanf returns items read).
